caption: Be sure to review Yelp Reviews before making a reservation here, I should have listened. Frist off, I am not normally writing reviews on negative experiences.  But, when I am outlaying cash for an experience, I am looking for value in exchange of hard-earned money.   You must know that as you make reservations here, you pay $20.00 per person and this is NOT applied to your check, it is a fee that you just pay.  I am a business owner and I get profit, but this fee is crazy. The gals that greet you are discriminating at best, they look you up and down and then to the seating chart to decide where they are going to seat you.  Since I, along with everyone else prefers a window seat, I simply requested a window seat, they have a second row of seating off the windows in a crowded, not Covid friendly dining area.  We were escorted to the back of the restaurant to a window seat, across for the staff who were eating there.  GREAT, not! As a seasoned business owner, a woman of means and a Chicagoan my whole life, I knew I was being retaliated against for asking for another seat, because I had a seat overlooking the sewage treatment plant and the roof exhaust. Absolutely no view … The only thing good about the meal was the salad, the rest subpar, lukewarm, no taste and the wine is a cheap table wine with no flavor and $15.00 a glass. This Restaurant is old, smelly and in a bad need of a renovation; the chairs are so old, they are covered with a fabric that kept falling off, when were they washed last?  The vide is 1960’s gold, with our $400.00 check/bill, you need to reinvest. Tsk Tsk If you make reservations at The Signature Room in the Handcock Building, you’ll have a better experience.

Do not waste your time or your money with this Restaurant. The food is not up to par for the price you pay. The view is amazing if you have the right tables. My girl and I flew in to Chicago for a nice weekend and were so looking forward to a amazing dinner. But the Cite was a complete let down. I have never seen her want to get out of a restaurant so fast.
My birthday dinner with my family amazing view luv it🙏🏽💞💞🎈🎊🎁🎂
restaurant has very rude staff plus now they have a cover charge but other restaurant in the area doesn't have that are high end restaurant . poor service i would not recommend this place at all

Wonderful service, amazing view, good food..but...DO NOT BUY EXPENSIVE PACKAGES! They are charging TWICE as much as you can order from the menu! WE got check for 198$ and were charged 400$, cause it was prepaid package.  Customer service lady just hanged up on me telling me that I am wasting her time! How rude! So basically if you buy package for 25$ each and get food for 168$,( for 2 person), you will spend the most 250$, for same service of 400$ package (for.2 people)
super friendly staff, very welcoming and I loved the food. I can't wait to go back.
Awesome place with someone special

My credit card concierge suggested this restaurant when I needed a place to go last minute. I decided to book with the deposit, and read about the restaurant later.  When I logged in to see the reviews, I was worried. The restaurant had several negative reviews, and I was shocked that this was recommended to me. However, my experience at Cité was wonderful.  I was quickly seated and the views of the city were breathtaking. My waitress suggested several dishes, and she was very excited for me to be dining with them. I told her I’d pretty much leave the food up to her recommendations. She suggested the escargot (delicious), the salmon (it was wild caught, and an absolute delicacy), and I finished my night with a very thoughtfully crafted chocolate dessert that I am still dreaming about. The wine I chose was also excellent, and the entire experience was memorable.  I’m not sure why so many people had a negative experience here, but mine was amazing and I would not hesitate to go back!

Thank you so much for a perfect evening!  I visited Cité Restaurant for a date night it was just perfect. I am so thankful for having a wonderful time! My table had roses on it! The waiter was so kind and very fast and always asked if everything was fine and if I needed anything. There was nice music playing in the background. I would definitely recommend and most likely come back!

Made a reservation for a window view here only to be told once I arrived at the restaurant that there were no window tables available. They offered to sit me at the back of the house, which is facing the lake, but is extremely misleading given what they advertised, and disappointing given that when it’s dark out, there is nothing to see. They justified this as “a window seat is a window seat....” They then sent me back downstairs to wait for a window view, only to call back not even 5 minutes later to have a table available... on the other hand, my server Antonio was so great and welcoming. The food and wine were great and the wait staff was very sweet. I now understand why they have so many mixed reviews on customer service.
Excellent attention. Is it a spectacular view, a cozy place for couples
Had a lovely 10 year anniversary here and it was fabulous

This place was so amazing, romantic, pretty to have dinner at. The views are 10/10. The atmosphere is romantic and quiet, the servers are very nice and very attentive. Food was also 10/10. Perfect place to have our galentine dinner at! I would definitely recommend and most likely come back!

Me and my husband bought a Valentines day package and was soo hoping to love the whole experience but ... no .. First of all, very crowded, rude and unorganized stuff, long wait for a table ( booked the reservation one month in advance) . Second, the food was not good at all- I ordered a duck at first for my main - ended up returning it because of the smell it had. Second try - I ordered filet mignon - it was maybe the worst filet mignon I ever ordered, I wanted it well done made, they gave me a medium well.. The potatoes for the side was not even fully cooked . I can keep going but the main idea is that this kind of food and service don’t cost $500..
Wonderful time :) 😃

Ambience was great food excellent but I wish I can give service more than 2 stars. They forgot the chocolate covered strawberries that were prepaid for my daughter's 18th birthday and after all was said and done they said "oh there is something about strawberries do you want them?) And then I paid $25 per person for rose petals $100 that was only worth 1 stem of a rose. I also paid a lot of money for 1 hour photography/video but got a sweet unprofessional lady that was asking us how we wanted to pose!!!! So basically $350 down the drain. Before you go eat there make sure they don't oversell products.  I understand they're trying to survive thru a pandemic but pls don't rip people off. I am a nurse a frontliner and it was my first time in a year to go out and celebrate my daughter's special 18th birthday and she even felt I overpaid. The marketing manager found a fool in me and I paid!.Does the picture look like $100 worth of rose petals???

Minimal menu do to covid. The staff is very friendly and willing to please to the out most, the chef's willingness to please, walks around asking to see if you enjoy your meal. I enjoyed the music the atmosphere and the views of the city. For starters our family had the crab bisque, delightful. Followed by the young Amish chicken roasted and crispy under a sauce of olive mushrooms with some creamy risotto on the side delicious. And for dessert,  I enjoyed the cream Brule. We're thinking of returning in spring.
Very nice and food was great. Service very good
Me and my husband celebrated our anniversary and I love the food the view everything a bout this restaurant

We had a dinner reservation for 4 on Wednesday, December 30, 2020. We were celebrating our anniversary and told that Cite offered a special experience that required us to prepay for our dinner in advance. They charge $179 per person and we received service equivalent to a mid-level restaurant chain or less. First of all, there was 1 employee working the entire restaurant who was very difficult to understand or communicate with. It’s clear he was over extended working all the tables, the bar and host stand. We were seated next to a table that was definitely less than 6 feet away. When we called Cindy upon booking the reservation, she assured us that the restaurant was serious about practicing social distancing. This was not the case. When we asked to order alcoholic beverages, the waiter was reluctant to take our orders stating that he had no way of accepting payment and that we would have to write sensitive credit card info down on a piece of paper. This was highly unprofessional. My husband asked for a scotch list. He said they didn’t have one and instructed us to walk to the bar and take a look at the bottles. He also made it clear that he was not the bartender and could only make simple drinks. I’ve never experienced this type of bar service at an “upscale restaurant”. The food was underwhelming. The lobster bisque was a bit bland and lukewarm. The creme brûlée was fine, but our entrees were the most disappointing. We were specifically told to refer to the menu online which listed filet mignon as one of the main entree options. When it came time to order it, the waiter told us that only the NY strip was available and not the filet. This was ridiculous. There is a quality and price disparity between a filet and NY strip and furthermore if we had known it was not an option up front we might have gone to another restaurant. The salmon was also over cooked and a bit tough. We paid for our dinners well in advance where there should have been enough food for us to be able to choose from all the options. I felt like this was poor planning on the kitchen’s part. In addition to the poor dining experience, there were multiple people in pajamas and casual clothing just waltzing in to take photos of the view. When the waiter asked if they were there for dinner, they stated they lived in the building and apparently this was justification enough to interrupt our dinner to loiter in the dining room and talk to their friends and take pictures. It just seemed a bit ridiculous that a dinner priced this high would have such a casual ambiance and multiple interruptions. Overall, we had high expectations for celebrating our anniversary here and we’re deeply disappointed. This is not the type of experience they should be advertising as upscale.

Where to begin... we were invited to celebrate our friends wedding anniversary on Dec 30th. Now due to Covid they offer a 3 course prefix menu which must be prepaid in order to keep your reservation( not a problem). We chose package #1 $179pp tax and tip included not alcoholic beverage but a  cash bar would be available. Our reservation was for 8pm we arrived a little late (15-20min) and was rudely told you know we close at 10pm (of course we do it’s a city ordinance). However, the time we arrived is irrelevant when our entire meal is completely pre-paid. Not to mention it’s only 3 courses which doesn’t take long to eat. Once seated we tried to order drinks and was told there is no bartender *side eye * website says cash bar available. Our server can barely speak English but is very accommodating by trying to make basic drinks. We’re then informed they can’t take cash and we have to write our credit card number on a piece of paper so they can charge us the next day. Apparently there’s only the server and chef working and no cash register I guess. We were a party of four and ordered the lobster bisque, (2) Alaskan salmon, (2) New York Strips, and creme brûlée. The lobster bisque was mixed reviews I found it lacking and bland whereas my husband thought it great. Both the Salmon were a little overcooked, dry, and tasteless but the couscous was very flavorful. The steaks and fingerling potato were tender with one being more savory than the other. The highlight of the evening was the creme brûlée which DID NOT disappoint. Rich, creamy custard with the right amount of crispness and very fresh raspberries atop.  All in all the meal was definitely not worth the price nor was the experience. When we had called the lady kept referring to the Cit’e experience and if that was suppose to be it it was extremely lackluster. The service was okay and food subpar. Not to mention groups of the general public kept coming in to take pictures of the view. They sold a private elegant affair and it was nothing of the sort. Save yourself time and money there plenty of other places where u can get amazing service and better food for $900 bill after drinks.
Perfect area for the view

Thank you so much for a perfect evening! I visited Cité Restaurant to celebrate my birthday. It was just perfect. I am so thankful for having a wonderful time! I had a couple of questions and wishes before I arrived so I communicated with Cindy and she answered always very quick and friendly and fulfilled all my wishes! When I arrived I was amazed!! The view is stunning, I could get enough of it! The restaurant is 360 degree so you can would in a circle and enjoy the view over the whole area! My table had roses on it! The waiter was so kind and very fast and always asked if everything was fine and if I needed anything. Very careful staff! There was nice music playing in the background. The food was unbelievable good! I can’t remember when I had such good food! Thank you very much to the chef for preparing such a mouth watering 3 course menu! I am so thankful to all of you for making this night a very special and wonderful one that I will always remember! Your german friend Nadine

Fancy , expensive , delicious food, empty . We were here before covid and it wasn’t that packed which I don’t really mind. I loved the duck the meat was so tender, I prefer poultries if I have a choice . And it’s so rare where you could eat it . It was really good . But $$$$ place so 4 stars .
Amazing view, delicious food ! I love this place
great food, service and ambiance is phenomenal
Great service and views!
View was so pretty.  Was not impressed by the food. Price is for the views really.
Very nice here. Great view of the city and lake and it’s even better at night. Food was amazing here so you can’t go wrong with the menu
Atmosphere, Staff, View, and Food was Amazing!!! Highly recommended!
Very nice
The views are beautiful.  Me and my gf went for our anniversary.  The food was great and the host was too. The food didnt get me full at all. We went home and  ordered a pizza

This was an amazing experience. The restaurant staff was very helpful and extremely present.The view is amazing and the food was great. The only issue we had was the valet parking. The clearance for the valet parking is at 6 feet. We were in a Chevy Silverado truck, however accommodations was made for us. 10/10 would recommend again.
The wow factor is off the charts here! The views, the food and drinks were amazing! I only had 1 night to visit Chicago and man was I glad I choose this restaurant!!! A+ 👍👍
Great time celebrating friends birthday.
Great food and great service! Cant beat the view of the city and lake Michigan
Beautiful place to take your love one,the view of Chicago is breathtaking, amazing staff,I will be back
My wife and I Loved the experience.  The view was stunning on a rainy evening. We have to experience the ambiance on a sunny day!! Great customer service and the food was good!!
Our experience was really great! The workers were so polite once we arrive up untill we left. Our server was nice and we had nice setup with good view. Perfect for lovely date.
Great view, great hospitality, great food. Evelyn and the staff made us feel special on out first anniversary.
Food and service was great.  Beautiful views of the city

Window 🕷 are the scariest and worst thing a restaurant can offer. The view is beautiful,  but when you are served food and spiders and cobwebs around you - you feel like vomiting. We paid so much money for a look, when i looked at the bar all the time so as not vomit from spiders. Prices are too expensive for the service.

Food and view the best. Staff/ waiters did something I will never forget the waiter confronted myself and date at the door. He asked was there prombkem with the food?  I replied it was find he opens the book with tip in it looks at the $30 tip then says was there a promblem with the service? I replied the service was fine. He again opens the books looks at the tip I left and then says is there a promblem? By then I have had enough with this waiter and told him I am having a promblem now and told him to please go away. I will never forget this visit.
Great views of the city, but food was mediocre, service was poor, and wine was 50% higher than in comparable restaurant not on the top floor. Won't go there again.

Food was sub-par. Definitely paying for the view. Would recommend going and ordering fries ($12) and getting any pictures you want. The view was stunning and the food’s presentation was done well - just didn’t taste awesome. Didn’t see our waitress much- but the guy who did the water was definitely on top of it & that was awesome.

Beautiful sunset views of Chicago. Perfect for special occasions! Very limited menu but great variety. Great selection of wines🥂 Best time to reserve during summer months is 7-8:30. View of Navy Pier and LSD on north side of restaurant; better night view on the south side, but all seats are great. Friendly staff. We enjoyed a very special evening.
Beautiful 😍 Loved it. Great service and great experience and atmosphere!

Food was good, service was great and quick, views were great. The jazz music was perfect for a romantic dinner night. However, on my reservation I requested a window seat with the city view and when we got there we got a window seat with a view of just the water. We asked to move and they were hesitant even though there was hardly anyone there. They said we could not get window seats with the city view even though they were empty! I still don't get the reason why? Halfway through our meal I went to the bathroom and saw that all city-view window seats were occupied even though they denied to seat us there when they were empty. Whoever makes the reservation for the earlier time should get whatever seat they want. Had to ask to move tables.

Had our 15th wedding anniversary at Citè and had a wonderful experience.  The views are amazing of Lake Michigan and of Chicago.  The food was excellent and the staff was absolutely amazing.  Highly recommend going here if you are looking for a romantic dinner in Chicago.
Absolutely beautiful view of the city and the Lakeshore! Very expensive! Nice atmosphere.
Great food and great service
Amazing as always...

I like this place it's very fancy! I got engaged here and it was beautiful! The photographer who took the pictures of my engagement was amazing! Food wise not too happy with some of the portions of food or menu variety
Delicious food, incredible wait staff, beautiful experience and views.
The view was nice, the food was ok, but they sat us by the door and I really didnt like that.
Good views and food. Excellent service.
Parents took me and the crew out for my birthday dinner! Excellent views of the city from every seat! Amazing menu. Definitely a place to impress or enjoy your family and friends!!!
Elegant place with pleasant atmosphere, the treatment is very friendly but the food in general we did not like, the onion soup and the lobster soup terrible.  overall terrible food
Place is awesome but food is ok for me
Magnificent Views and Food!

You walk in off the elevator and you are immediately hit with the Skyline Views of Chicago which are breath taking...truly stunning from the 70th Floor. It was a really cold night but the hostess that greeted us brought a warmth and a smile that made things really welcoming and comfortable. We were taken to our table and immediately greeted by our Captain who was very knowledgeable and made the perfect suggestions ...Food was delicious, loved the filet mignon and lobster mac n chez. Service was exceptional, we could have not have asked for a more perfect night. Old school unpretentious fine dining at it's best...
Lovely dinner with amazing view. Service and steak on par. I Recommend.
Good food, nice veiw, freindly staff.

360’ view of Chicago, Extremely Hospitble service. The very best experience in fine dining a couple can have. After been taking to our table with a beautiful view, Margaritas were brought out just how I requested when I reserved. King Alaskan Salmon sautéed spinach, I had Scallops w sautéed spinach. Live music playing A James Bond theme.
Food was good. You definitely pay for the view. Which was well worth it!

I have no idea why this place doesn’t have 5 star ratings all around. Myself and a friend had an absolutely INCREDIBLE experience here. It was the highlight of our trip to Chicago! The views were beyond amazing, service was top notch, food was delicious. Somehow we had almost the entire restaurant to ourselves on a Monday evening - We couldn’t get over it because we felt like it should’ve been packed out. Worth every dollar spent and we hope to be back someday! 11/10 would recommend!
The Food was really good, the piano music was nice for the ocassion ,Good vibe.
Great atmosphere.  Excellent service.  Great food.  Dennis was a pleasure!
Horrible food, salad was not fresh ,expensive , poor customer service, nice view from the 70th floor

This were our first time here. My Husband and I are celebrating our 23rd Anniversary. Everyone was so nice. We were greeted with a smile when we first entered. Our waiter Peter and Pablo were awesome. Omg, they were so sweet and very pleasant. Drinks were really good. Not watered down like most  Establishments, you really taste your liquor. Food was good. The view we had was beautiful. Music was romantic. We will be returning.
The attentive service was fantastic . Noe really did a great job of making me feel taken care of . The views were beautiful. The food was delicious.

Made a reservation for Valentines Day and was extremely DISAPPOINTED! The hostess was extremely rude and we were seated at a window seat that had no view after we were showed a much nicer table that was given to someone else. The V-Day Menu was a disaster..$175 a person plus $80 tip included in the bill. The menu barely had any options and the food was barely mediocre. Dinner for 2 cost us $500 plus $20 parking. For that money I shouldve left mid blowingly satisfied, but that was not the case...Overall Cite is OVERPRICED, OVERHYPED, AND FOOD IS MEDIOCRE! Wont be returning again

We were told to sit at the bar and wait for our table, a gentleman informed us to take the table behind us whenever we were done with our drinks. While we were seated a lady hostess came up to us and asked why we were seated there because it was reserved for someone else. We told her that a gentleman told us that was our table. They made us move to a table with a view that wasn’t nearly as great. We didn’t pay $500 to be accused of stealing a table. I will never go back.

Absolutely the most beautiful view of any restaurant I’ve been to in Chicago. Our server Peter was extremely knowledgeable and kind, and the food was out of this world. Small portions, but very filling and rich in flavor. Two great friends of mine came to visit me in Chicago, and Cite really made their experience that much more special. 😌

The only great thing about this place was the view! The food is not good at all. We ordered a New York strip steak and a filet mignon  and they were underseasoned and bland. The worst part was the desert, we ordered a chocolate cake and a creme brulee. The chocolate cake was refrigerated and tasted like it was in the refrigerator for a couple days. I've had better food at the cheesecake factory! Will probably never set foot here again.
VIEW AN FOOD

I take my family to this great spot many times a year! This is my favorite restaurant to pass a nice evening.  I go to this spot regularly. The food is excellent, the crew is helpful and the prices are fair. I enjoy meeting in this restaurant to have a decent dinner.
I prefer this restaurant a lot. theres a happy ambiance. The cuisine is very tasty. the service is effective and the crew is friendly. The cost is modest. I warmly recommend.

I visited Cite' on this 1-25-2020!  It was a great experience. Nice views!  Great service!  I had a party of 11, everyone  loved the food, and the overall service.  Edita, The private event coordinator was very accommodating and  understanding. I found a new place to relax and visit on my days off! I love Chicago! I love Cite!  I will be visiting again, and again. Thank You!

The place was nice and the view was beautiful. The duck and pork chop were amazing but I also got the French onion soup to me it taste and looked horrible. Everything else was really good and decently priced. I recommend just not the soup.
Very nice view
Expect one of the best views in town. The dishes are very well cooked too. I had the fillet, with the onion soup as a starter - both excellent.
The view 👍, food 👎, service👎

This was by far the worst NYE experience. My fiancé hasn’t been able to celebrate NYE is 10 years due to her working in the food and beverage industry and usually has to work. She was finally off and we were able to finally celebrate together. We bought last minute tickets for $250 each for a 6 course meal.y fiancé is pregnant and the food needed to be prepared a certain way which we specified in the beginning. They brought the soup out which was cold but we decided to eat it anyways. Next was the duck that we said needed to be well done for her. They brought it out medium rare so we sent it back to be re cooked. They left my duck and we waited about 10-15 min for her new one to come out.  I waited to eat mine and by the time hers came out mine was cold and never offered to give me a new one or take it when they took hers. Next was our steaks. Hers came out rare. Again we sent it back. They took the same meat and cooked it longer which took another 10-15 min longer. It still was medium rare when she got it. They also didn’t offer to bring me a new one as I waited for hers to come out do we weren’t eating alone. Last was our dessert. We order a crème brûlée and a cheese cake. They brought out a fondue. So we had to send that back and wait for the correct dessert. All in all we couldn’t enjoy our time together because we were continuously complaining and sending things back. Not once did a manager come to talk to us. I called a couple days later to explain the situation and the lady manager I spoke with said she would help us out and talk to the owner. I never received a call back and called again. They said they needed more time and said they probably wouldn’t be able to do anything and that she still wasn’t able to talk to the owner. I have been trying to call a few times a week and now they are ignoring my calls. Their customer service especially from a management stand point as been very unprofessional.

(Translated by Google) The view from the 72nd floor on which the restaurant is situated is incredibly beautiful at night. All of Downtown Chicago is at your feet. The food and wines are also of excellent quality. Take a big wallet with you because it is downright expensive. But just do it when you are in Chicago. I would reserve by the way.  (Original) Het uitzicht vanaf de 72e verdieping waarop het restaurant is gesitueerd is bij avond ongelooflijk mooi. Heel Downtown Chicago ligt aan je voeten. Het eten en de wijnen zijn ook nog eens van uitstekende kwaliteit. Neem een dikke portemonnee mee want het is ronduit duur. Maar gewoon doen wanneer je in Chicago bent. Ik zou wel reserveren trouwens.
Truly an amazing dining experience. Would go back 100 times if I could.
Great view, great food.

My friends and I went to Cite for the new year celebration and it wasn’t even close to our expectations. Too pricey, medium-low quality food, and horrible service. It might be okay to go there for a romantic dinner but not recommended for the NYE. So disappointed!

Overpriced, disorganized and low qualityi normally don’t leave reviews unless something is really wrong, like what our family experienced here. The only thing you pay for is the view which you can get in other places for this price besides quality food and service. We went there for NYE dinner and first of all, the service was super slow! We were sitted on the table around 8 and finished the menu around 11:45!! Had to wait too long after each course until the server finally came to ask if we’re ready for the next course. The steak was overcooked, dry and even burnt on top! The duck breast was almost raw and the salad dressing was not tasty at all. There was a light piano music until midnight and silence after that! They gave us champagne 30 minutes before the midnight but there was no music, count down or any NY flare at midnight which seems something pretty normal and easy for most bars and restaurants to organize.

I would give zero star if I could! Had the worst NYE experience ever at this so called « fine dining ». Food quality: mediocre at most Service and staff: acceptable Atmosphere: horrible for a special night like NYE. No celebration, music or count down! You’d basically pay a few hundred bucks for a moment if horrible silence and awkward noises of people during the countdown! Seriously??? Couldn’t you just play something from radio, at least, instead of keeping the crowd watching fireworks in the absolute annoying silence? Couldn’t be more disappointed of spending our NYE at Cité!
Great experience the views and top notch service
I loved celebrating our two year anniversary up there and also getting seranated with the piano when they asked us for a song.
Food and service were awesome !!
The view is fantastic. Great place for a nice dinner date .

We went to Citi tonight for a little Christmas cheer.  It was so sad and boring.  There were eight customers and at least 8 employees counting the piano player and singer.  The food I cannot speak to as I have no sense of taste or smell.  The service was S-L-O-W.  The view, of course was amazing.  I am sure there is something up though.  There is no way they are making money.  Money laundering maybe?
Amazing views,  great cocktails.
360 deg. views of the city are awesome, the food is not bad, but the service is lacking; especially for a luxury restaurant.
Elegant atmosphere with breathtaking views, with quality cuisine to match. This is a must-visit location for tourists and locals alike.
The best view
Nice place.an very good food.and amazing view
This place never disappoints!
Beautiful,romantic,the best view and good food.
The perfect place for the special evening  or casual dining. Live music and a view to die for. You have to order the bananas foster for dessert..... served tableside!!!

I never leave bad reviews but this place is terrible. The view is beautiful but that's where it ends. The service was atrocious. The bus boy and waiter were very rude. The food was terrible. We ordered scallops and a ribeye and both came out raw! I told the waiter to return it and take it off the bill. He didn't come back for 20 minutes so I asked to speak to a manger but apparently there was no manager working on a Saturday night!!!  They eventually took it off the bill but they were very rude about it like it was my fault. The food is terrible and overpriced, the service is worse then the food. Don't go here. It ruined our entire night.
The absolute best ribeye steak I have ever had

I normally NEVER write a bad review, but this was such a horrible experience that I must share it. I made reservations at Cite to celebrate my mother's 70th birthday. We were seated right away at a table with a magnificent view. The bus boy filled our water right away as soon as we sat down. It took our waiter approximately 15 minutes to take our drink order. He had an attitude and was not friendly at all. After waiting another 15-20 minutes, we still had not received our drinks. We asked to have the waiter come to our table  in which he did. We inquire where our drinks were and he was extremely rude and said the bartender was behind on drinks. Mind you, the restaurant was not even very busy. I had told him this was my mother's birthday and that the service for an upscale restaurant was not acceptable.  He could care less as to the situation and offered no resolve. I told him when I made the reservation that it was for a celebration and they said they would have a menu made with my mothers name and offered a piece of cake in honor of her birthday. He stated they didn't have the menu made. I asked to speak to a manager and he said he was one of them. I told him he acted extremely unprofessional and had ruined our evening and we would NEVER return again. We got up and left the restaurant. It was appalling the way we were treated and the lack of care that he showed to us. The city has a plethora of upscale restaurants that have views like Cite that will treat you with dignity and respect. Do not waste your time and money going to Cite where the staff has no regards for you. Thanks Cite for ruining my mother's birthday. You have lost a repeat customer for life!
Great view price on food at bar a nice surprise!
No view because of fog, could’ve give us discount for that, $50 tip because they want it and never ask if we want to leave a tip or not, food was average.
The best view of Lake Michigan at night.

The view is to die for! This is the epitome of romanticism. The food on a weekday dinner left me not so impressed, especially for the price. Plated well most times but a but lacking in flavor. Dessert tasted like the fridge. I will try again to see if we can add another star.

This is absolutely the WORST restaurant I’ve been to! We had reservations at 9:15 didn’t get our food until about 10:45. The food was horrible, cold, and it wasn’t presented nicely. I have been to many upscale restaurants and this is by far the worst one. I will never return here EVER AGAIN. I can honestly say that the only thing we enjoyed was the dessert! And the waiter had a problem with us complaining as if we were being difficult. I hate it there! If I can give it zero stars I would

Sorry to say this was a disappointment. We came for our anniversary and between waiting 10 min to get water and the kids who hung out in front of the bathrooms making cat sounds, the mood didn’t do it for me. While the food was good, I felt like I would have rather paid more and eaten at Ruth’s Chris. There wasn’t a view because of the fog, but I don’t feel that would have helped much. I also made it a point to say it was our anniversary and considering what we were paying, figured we’d be offered a champagne toast or just something to make it a little more special. We got the chilled sea food platter (which comes with 4 pieces of the smallest oysters and shrimp I’ve ever seen), the scallop risotto, filet, asparagus and fondue for dessert- I had two glasses of Cannonball Cab, $300 later I was wishing we’d have gone to Coopers Hawk and saved our money. This place felt like a TGIF with a fancy name.
I love the view! Best in Chicago with beautiful fireworks.

The food was delicious! The food came in a timely manner and the captain and server assistant were extremely friendly. The captain was very accommodating and helped us order based on our food preferences and restrictions. The server assistant was very attentive and lively when he came by. It was a really relaxing time and the view of the skyline, Lake Shore Drive and the lake was unbeatable! Dining while the sun was setting was the highlight of the night. There was also a photographer there to capture the moment too. I would definitely come back and tell more of my friends to come.

Awesome view, lovely ambiance, and great service. Would definitely recommend for a date night or for a different perspective of the city for out of town guests as a better alternative to the Signature Room in the Hancock.

Pretty nice place. Good food as well. Giving one less star because there's not a lot to choose from on the menu. vegetarian options would have been nice. Their fish was definitely fresh and tasty. We had their salmon and and sea bass. I did see alot of reviews complaining about the service. I didn't see anything out of place with service, nothing to complain about. The staff was nice!

You pay for the view not the food. The food is expensive but very poor quality. I ordered the duck, it was charred and and so dry, drier than any duck I have ever had. The view is great but certainly not worth as much as you pay. I would suggest just going to the bar for a drink and sipping the food.

I gave it a 2 star rating based on the customer service experience. I was there to celebrate an anniversary the hostess name Brian was awful and should not be working at such restaurant.  When I first arrived I told him I wanted to wait for my party and he told me that wasn't a good idea and I need to be seated now. Then he's seated us in a horrible location and another server came by and told me I could move and walk me back to Brian.  He told me no, I cannot move and that's the only seat when there were plenty of tables available. It took forever for someone to come to serve us and we ended up with someone by the name of Amir which never came to the table to check on us until the end of the night. We had to flag down other servers for assistance.  Meanwhile we heard him using profanity all night where we was seated,i was awful.

Def. overrated. We got there and we did not have anyone talk to us until after 15 min the waiter came to pour us water and asked us if we’re ready to order it’s when he realized we did not have the food menu nor the drinks menu Yet. Ordered the tuna tartare. Plain, blent. No taste. The filet was cold.  The rack of lamb was cold. The waiter was unprofessional and continuously bothered me without any consideration of the other person with me.

I agree with the review below, Nina DiCarlo's!  We were there on Aug 31st, which was the last fireworks day for the season at Navy Pier.  We wanted to celebrate our little staycation in the city. We were 5 minutes early for our reservations, ended up waiting for 20 minutes in the tiny vestibule as we were not allowed at the bar with two small children, ages 5 and 3, who were really excited to see the fireworks.  We had excellent views!  But that's all the restaurant has going for it.  The service is horrible.  Upon getting seated, it took them 30min to bring bread.  20 MORE minutes to take our DRINK orders.  By that time the fireworks have already ended.  The wait-staff couldn't be found.  We had to stop random personnel to ask to be waited on.  After that, a person came over asking why we haven't placed our food orders yet - because no one asked.  Then two waiters started pointing fingers at each other, saying "he was supposed to take your order, no he was, no I wasn't...". Anyway, long story short, our table turned out to be unassigned to a waiter and so we were left without service for close to an hour, at which point it was time to take the kids for bed as it was getting really late.  We never ended up trying the food there.  We did enjoy a bottle of wine, which the waiter told us to "ENJOY", sarcastically, after we asked to speak to the manager of the facility. The manager never arrived, probably because no one related the message to him/her. We couldn't wait any longer, so we left to put our children to bed, who were hungry but patient through it all.  I was impressed. Needless to say we will never come back to try their food, as there are many other restaurants in Chicago.  I would not recommend this place besides maybe a few drinks at the bar during fireworks.
Best salmon I've ever had. My girlfriend had the scallops, those were amazing too.

Hugely disappointed.  This was supposed to be finer dining for my husband and my 20th anniversary.  First they had no record of our reservation.  The view was fantastic and the service fairly quick however the food was average at best.  The $40 salmon was no different than one could expect at Baker's square. The $11 spinach side was bitter and tasteless.  My husband's fish was acceptable but not outstanding.  His escargot was good but again not exceptional.  Totally did not feel we were at a quality restaurant.  The waiter even brought my husband's appetizer to me, an amature's mistake.

My husband and I had dinner in Cite Chicago last August 31, 2019. We came 30 minutes earlier so we sat on the bar and had wine. When the time of our reservation came, there was no available table for us. We waited for 15 minutes, we ended up seating away from the window, which I requested, and we were the only table in that corner, next to a huge mirror. Our food was not that warm anymore but I didn’t want to return it as it would take much time for them to cook. Our plan to watch the fireworks wasn’t fulfilled as people were standing and we could only see a small portion of it. Our experience was totally not great! The only good thing in this restaurant is the spectacular view! Asked if I recommend them? My answer is no.

Our evening there was exceptional. The view is breathtaking. The building front desk gave us very precise directions as soon as we entered the building. Our waiter was very sweet and made every effort possible to make sure our evening was perfect. Food was amazing. The price is very high but you definitely get what you pay for.  Only bad side, the young lady at the entrance of the restaurant was arrogant, ignored my greeting and seemed out of place. Her attitude really contrasted with the one of all other members of staff.
Beautiful view, however the decor inside seems dated... Could use an update...

Do not plan anything romantic here, they will ruin it. You are told many things that will not happen. The staff is very rude.They didn’t ask anyone at my table if the wanted any wine or drinks. We was given warm water to drink. The manager on duty was trying to tell my wife what to eat. The food is nothing great. The service is bad. It’s crazy but I feel like they just don’t give a f**k about the customers.

If I could give Cite and our experience 0 stars, I would. My poor, sweet husband wanted to do something special for me for my birthday seeing as it fell on the weekend of the Air and Water Show; he saw Cite offered a viewing and brunch for $85/ pp prepaid brunch, so he jumped on it. Our reservation was for 12:15, we got there at 12:17, and it was a bizarre experience from the moment we stepped out of the elevator. We waited awkwardly at the host stand for 10-15 mins with an occasional "photographer" coming by saying the hostess will be right with us. Someone finally comes and for being advertised as an "upscale" restaurant, the hostess was dressed SUPER casually (literally in athletic leggings) and EXTREMELY frazzled. She told us they didn't have our table ready and they were, "trying to kick people out to make room for us." Huh?? She rushed us to the bar, where we sat with several other guests also waiting for tables, who also had reservations they prepaid for. Well, 2 terrible drinks ($35), and an HOUR later, my husband was about to lose it. This was not the birthday he expected for me. He goes up to the host stand asking if we can get refunded, and some extremely rude gentleman just walks up and says, "did he mention a refund? Nope, sorry, no refunds." My husband being the accountant he is said, "then I will dispute this with Chase because the promised services were not delivered and this is fraud." He walked away to get me to leave, and 1 minute later, the frazzled hostess came to seat us. She sat us next to the kitchen with a huge external exhaust fan next to us. We were starving at this point, and so badly wanted to salvage the day, so we sat down. We had no water and had to have the bartender tell us where the buffet was since he saw us awkwardly sitting there. We went to the buffet, and I swear, it was like a buffet from a continental breakfast at a hotel chain. Yes, they had shrimp, and some really weird meat they labeled as "lump crab meat"  and a carving station, but all of these premium items were of the absolute worst and disgusting quality. The shrimp especially was so slimy and soggy. As we sat and picked at our food, we were so thirsty. My husband asked a fleeting waiter for water, and he told us to go to the bartender and ask. WHAT??? That was the last straw. We asked for our check and although we prepaid 85 per person, for what was the WORST dining experience of my life, we got charged a service fee and some other booking fee. WHAT SERVICE?? To top off the terrible and bizarre service, as we were about to step on the elevator to leave, the hostesses say, "thank you for being so easy and leaving right away, we like people like you." It was such a strange "compliment," and we left there baffled. Clearly, this place is outdated, can't keep up with the amazing culinary competition in the city, and should not be open any longer if they can't get the hint about their terrible service.

My experience at Cite for my very 1st time was amazing. The food was awesome, everything I had was GREAT. My View was the BEST in the house. Oh and I must say we had xclnt company Nick & Natel Gouletas & Family, My new found friends.
Excellent service. Great food. Better view.  One of the best places to be for any occasion in Chicago.
Nice view ,but food is not
We had a dinner reservation on a Sunday night . After waiting for 20 minutes without being greeted we decided it’s not worth the stay can’t say much about the food . But the vibe really sucks .

The view is lovely from the 70th floor! Food was good too. Signage is poor so a little hard to know if you are in the right place or where to go. Not all parts of restaurant are as nice; we were near a loud portable air conditioner.
I’m so disappointed in this place ! This place is so unprofessional!!

You're paying for the view, not the food. Honestly it was just ok: pork chop was over cooked, french onion soup was a let down, service was decently attentive. It's the kind of place you go when you want 5-star dining, but don't actually know what 5-star dining is.

I usually don’t leave reviews but with CITE I’m Extremely disappointed. Our reservation was at 930 which we showed up early and our seats were given away as a mistake by the front desk. We sat down around 9:40pm at a different location then initially discussed and arranged then we were moved again from our spot to watch the firework show. We watched the whole show until 10;30pm without even the waiter coming to our table and serving us. That’s when me and my fiancé got up and complained to Keith which was professional and offered 2 gift certificates to be sent in the mail. Have not received yet. But overall horrible experience and I’m hoping to come again without this debacle of supposedly to be an enjoyable dinner with my fiancée.  I’d like to add that Keith Was professional and friendly and apologetic!!!!

Service was slow. Scallops were undercooked. Steak was over cooked, and we were first there only ones with reservations and they stuck us behind the bar. The absolute worst I have ever had. Chili’s is better.
Love the view and super delicious food!!! When asked if it was a special occasion I said my fiancé’s birthday and they brought out a small cake with a candle! Absolutely loved it!
We had seabass and salmon and no complaints. The creme brulee is delicious. Waiter and staff was attentive. Bread was a little dry. The water and city view is beautiful.
Paid 60$ for 2 meals that were horrible and tasted super bad. Place is very nice and everything but I would rather go somewhere where the food is good than somewhere for the looks.
Enjoyed a wonderful birthday dinner great service delicious food outstanding atmosphere

Very bad experience with server, it wast a very special occasion and they ruined, and the worse was when we ordered dessert and they put a birthday note, not even close. The view was great but everything else ruined the great experience.

Best View In The City, The Bartender is awesome, Sara is A breath of fresh air.... Unfortunetly A comedy of errors & just bad effort ruins the rest. 4 times trays of glass hit the floor. 90 mins & they forget we're waiting! 90 more to get the food they also messed up. From errors to the end where 20 mins to get a container for the food to take with you. A Mess & A Shame, cause the view is amazing.... Sara, get to another place, ure 2 good for this one...

Great views, terrible food, terrible service.  First bottle of wine we ordered was warm and covered in rust, and once opened some random employee came by and told us to serve ourselves.  The food is way overpriced for the quality.  It’s shocking this place is still open.  Won’t go back and would not recommend.

Went for the 4th of July. Paid over $150 per person for the worst meal and service ever!  Got seated at 9pm but the server Dennis never came over until the hostess told him to because she noticed how annoyed I looked. It took well over 30 min to get a glass of wine. The server forgot that I asked for a 2nd glass and the hostess again had to tell him. Didn’t end up getting our main course until 10:40pm. The food was not good either. Took 2 bites of my filet and asked for the check. The view for the fireworks was good but everyone hovers over your table to see them which is not comfortable.
Very bad service! Waiting for the main dish and waiter was over 40 minutes, waiter did not even ask us once how is everything. It was very cold and all of the employees are very unpolite
Nice ambience
Great service and great food! Took my RedNerrus.com team out to celebrate a milestone and we were treated like great hard working people should be, with the upmost respect! Everyone was great!!
Upscale dining the way it's meant to be
Excellent service, staff very kind. Excellent view (you must to try to get one of the four tables with good view). Food awesome
(Translated by Google) The service is slow, the food rich.  (Original) El servicio es lento, los alimentos ricos.

Went there on Saturday. Made a reservation and everything. Got there on time and was seated. First thing I noticed was the AC wasn't working. Thats not really the restaurants fault so we looked past it. Then we sat down and no one served us for 35 minutes. I even tried calling for servers multiple times and was ignored. For a restaurant of such caliber and no one even served us or acknowledged us? Ridiculous. 35 minutes was enough and we walked out. Let the front hosts know, and they had the audacity to offer us a "complimentary dessert." Are you kidding me? I've worked as a server at Chilis and we offered to pick up entire tabs for a delayed entree to the table. AT CHILIS we offered this, and this place offered us a complimentary dessert. Anyways we ended up going to Bandera on Michigan Ave. Bandera served us the way you would expect a well run restaurant to be. I would recommend Bandera Restaurant to anyone. We came all the way from Denver and had chosen this for our big dinner. Thanks for ruining that. I'm sure Cite is a fine restaurant, the view is amazing. However, for us, it was a terrible experience. So I won't recommend it for anyone.

Go for the view, stay for the food. We were there for a hosted event so we didn't order from the menu, but the food that was prepared was excellent. I will definitely go back for a traditional dinner there.

We Celebrated Mothers Day at Cité. We had a Blast. Prime location for a High Rise View. The restaurant has an Old School Vibe, Calm and Relaxed with Smooth Entertainment. The Food also Old School But Executed Exceptionally Well. Believe me, I tried every dish at my table. We literally had a Flawless meal. My youngest daughter caught the Happy Hour Special right before it ended - Double Mini Cheese Burgers accompanied by some Great Fries. We enjoyed the Oysters and Escargot to start followed with the Venison, Amish Chicken and Prime Rib. For Dessert we Had Bananas Foster prepared Table Side along with The Chocolate Fondue. Parking is available but is Valet, Cité Validates. Other than it being aRainy Day I can iImagine a Gorgeous Sunset while Enjoying A Great Meal at Cité. We Will Definitely Return.

My husband took me there for my birthday, we had salmon it was ok, not the best. Then we ordered chocolate mousse cake they brought it with candle and all that, when we tasted the cake it tasted like mold! We told our server about it he brought us a new slice and it tasted like normal chocolate cake. They didn’t even apologize and our server came to our table to tell us that he was going to take the desert off from our check like he was doing us a favor. Bad food (I cannot believe they serve molded food), very outdated design, never going back there again!

Cite is supposed to be a special place but the customer service is terrible. The tablecloth was stained. The website says business casual but the hostesses were wearing tights. The lettuce in the salad was browning. All food/ drinks are over priced. Getting the same bottle of wine at whole foods is cheaper than the glass at the restaurant.

The view was beautiful and the service was amazing , being that I’m afraid of heights the host made my wife and I feel very comfortable. Our waiter Amir was outstanding, I definitely enjoyed celebrating our 10yr Wedding anniversary and would recommend this restaurant to any couple visiting the city of Chicago or anyone looking for a beautiful restaurant to share great memories with their spouse
View is nice. Food ok
Amazing view and amazing food. Expensive but worth it.
Beautiful beautiful place for birthday and anniversary but the food was just okay for me.

Unfortunate experience today at the Easter Sunday brunch buffet at Cite... apparently the air conditioning in the restaurant was not working, only heat was blasting in.. It was so unbearably hot that you couldn’t enjoy the meal and we could not wait to leave. I’ve given only two stars because of the fabulous view… the service for drinks was poor and because of the extreme heat in the restaurant, we left, feeling angry and cheated that we experienced this. I feel management should have alerted us to the problem when we checked in and given us the opportunity to decide whether we wanted to stay or leave. Who would want to be sitting there and sweating trying to enjoy your meal?
One word, AMAZING! My husband and I LOVE this place... Best Views in Chicago! You must try the butter poached lobster and tomahawk steak!
Very nice place. Good service and delicious food !!!!
Very great customer service. The food was excellent and the view was amazing.
The view from the restaurant was excellent,  food was great.
Great experience, awesome view of the city but the price is a bit high.

Vendors beware!! I am the owner of a high-rise window cleaning company that has washed the windows at the Cite restaurant four times last year. We were warned by employees that the owner doesn't like to pay their bills. After a dozen phone calls to the corporate office and to the manager at the restaurant, we've had no luck getting paid for the last two cleanings. Not even a call back from the corporate office!!
Food was good but this place needs some life.  Beautiful views but something is missing
Lobster bisque and Filet Fignon 😊 pretty great soup and dish!  Thank Chef Oscar for the great dinner!

Surprised my fiancé with a dinner here. I am a vegetarian and she is a pescatarian. Beautiful views, great service, and nice desserts. Not much options for vegetarians or vegans though besides some salads and a risotto. Anyway, I hope they change that. Till then keep yourself satisfied with eating at the 70th floor with amazing views of the city (just a heads up, it sways a little that high)

The food at Cite was just okay! Truffle Risotto was bland, Mediterranean salad was drenched in vinegrette....and the drinks were nothing special. We split a Prime ribeye which was just okay. Being a steak lover...I wasn't really impressed. The pomme puree had a horrible over-powering flavor of horseradish. It was just gross! Overall, nice view of the city as it has window seating that wraps 360 around the restaurant.

The view is amazing wine selection is great but if you want great tasting main course dish, this is not the place. The undercooked the lamb and over cooked the Salmon both were under seasoned. I’d rather have Smiths and Wollensky for the price.
EXCELLENT views,  great food,  CRUMMY service.   Waiter did not ask if we wanted a second drink,  took over half an hour to pay the check, almost missed the opening intermission as a result
The absolute best view! Amazing food! The duck was the best I ever had. Topped off with Bananas Foster! Freshly made at the table! Honestly I do not think I could ask for anything better!!

Beautiful view, very tasty food, very romantic atmosphere,  very attentive and professional staff! Me and my husband have been there twice , when my husband proposed me and on our anniversary,  both times where amazing, unforgettable memories!!!
Beautiful place
Great service,Great food, Spectacular view. Will definitely be going again.
LOL these guys are trying to hire "interns" to bring live sound equipment and perform for 3-4 hours for your dinner without paying them.  Classy.
Beautiful views, friendly service. Only just went for a few glasses of wine, but would definitely come back to try the food.
Beautiful place, very nice

The view from our table was fantastic. The Chicago skyline at night is absolutely beautiful. Our server was very nice and accommodating. The only thing that prevents me from giving Cite another star is that we felt the food was just average, especially considering the prices.

Incredible evening views of the city from the 70th floor. Service was exceptional and attentive. We were a party of 8 for a birthday and our birthday girl was treated very well helping make her day special. Food was fantastic as well as the service. A little addition to the ambiance included a live pianist and singer on our evening.
Great date night, attentive staff.

Probably hands down the best restaurant with a view in Chicago. Their foods always good, prices are reasonable and the staff are amazing! I highly recommend trying this place out if you're in the city.

View is fabulous on a clear night. Service is good, very polite, dedicated, yet could be polished a bit. Menu was tantalizing, food fell short of expectation. Overall an enjoyable experience  and will plan to return. Will just hope for some improvement then it will be a grand slam.
Beautiful views and ambiance, the food is average for the high prices however.
avoid this place the food was so bad and cold they had the heat up so high you couldn't enjoy the night the furniture was old need a little updated
Very good food nice place for diner with friends or family
Is there a better view of Chicago, I'm not sure. Located atop Lakepoint Tower is a first class restaurant
Beautiful, the view, wow.  Good food, very comfortable space.
Good Food.  Great Service.  Fantastic View from Window seats.  Impress a business client.   Treat the kids.  Step up your Anniversary.
Salmon came out raw steak didnt taste like anything never got a refill on drinks  very disappointed
Great place nice view food took forever to get to us. Small portions. Mac and cheese was amazing.

I would not even give any star if I could. I took my daughter and her fiance for thanksgiving dinner. All the food was cold and it was bland. It was not fresh. With the money you spens there you expect a decent meal which we did not get. View is nice but I will not be back there...

An absolutely wonderful evening with top shelf five star service and I didn't think anything less from Evangelina the place has breathtaking views the filet I had was perfect and the company was gracious this is a definite winner

Place is old and rundown. Poor mans Signature Room. Beautiful view, such a waste of a spectacular space. I wish this place would be taken over by someone who knows and cares about the restaurant business.  Food is barely eatable!! How can you screw up French Onion soup?!  Bass was bland flavorless, so was the Chicken and the Pork Chop!! Finally had to order the Mini Burgers from the bar menu and even that was very disappointing. Service was ok nothing spectacular. YOU’VE BEEN WARNED!

The view was beautiful.  The food was decent. The place is nice. My main complaint was the parking which is in the building. I was supposed to have four hours of complimentary parking with a validated ticket. I go to get my car near the expiration time and wait, and wait for the people ahead of me to get their cars. Only one person is getting the cars. My turn finally comes and I am told that I went over my allotted time by 10 minutes and must now pay the full $39.00 to park there. I explained that I was waiting in line for over ten minutes and was told that it was automated and there was nothing that could be done.  That was enough for me to never return to Cite. Plenty of other places in the city without scam pop parking policies.
Incredible!
Lobster too high and definitely over cooked
Not a friendly place! Nice views, but there are other places that offer views in Chicago with the outstanding service and good food!
A constant oralgasm with each and every bite. The thought of any condiment with any entree is a total disrespect to the chef and waitstaff. Thank you Ken for your patience
Great food and a great view.
Nice different restaurant as situated in 70th floor. Food qualities are great ... salad is tasty  but the amount should be more, like the usual Americans plates !

View is ok ,not Signature Room by any means but okay. Ambient is nothing to be amazed from and the food is average. Would go back but that doesn't mean you shouldn't give it a shot. Never know , maybe you like it.
Hands down one of the best restaurants in Chicago.
Very nice looking restaurant,  beautiful  views, food and steak was over rated.
Love
(Translated by Google) Excellent  (Original) Otimo
I have dined at Cité on special occasions and the food, ambiance, & service is impeccable!
You must dine here on nights that the fireworks are displayed at navy pier. Excellent view
Views are great. Food was average
Food was good.  Just like other good food.  The view was incredible.

The view is superb and the food & service were excellent. The manager & waiters were attentive throughout the meal. You will be paying for your view, so do not attend without being ready for that. The escargot were fat and served with tiny popovers which was a great touch. I also had the lamb and finished with creme brulee. The view is the main attraction. For anniversaries/events this is a perfect spot! But not somewhere you could dine regularly due to prohibitive prices, and I suspect other reviewers didn't know that before dining.
Amir and John were fantastic!  Food ... lobster Mac n cheese was great! The veggies were flavorful and the wine was divine. But that Filet...!  You will not be disappointed!
Panoramic view of the city. Great experience.
This place was amazing plus very clean an up scale the food and the view just amazing also. I forgot we have place like this in Chicago
Very romantic, cant beat the view of the lake and skyline. Food was good and expensive but we were full. Avoid sitting along path that will have other guests walking by your dinner plate.
The view is amazing, and that is basically what you're paying for because the food was only just above average. Still, if you can afford it, it does make for a really good Chicago memory.
Great views but service was extremely lacking for the price paid.
Awesome view. The food and service is very good. It has an intimate atmosphere. Prices are high but not ridiculous
Wonderful food and the best view in the city!
What an amazing view of Lake Michigan and Chicago. The food was good too.

For me this is the ultimate  in special occasion restaurants. The views anytime of year are spectacular. My last visit, I loved the scallops and risotto. The pepper sauce was a wonderful color with the perfect amount of citrus flavor. A very well done, high end restaurant.

The place is crawling with old hotel food kind of place. They serve you oysters in some kind bad red vinegar it smelled like something don't want to describe. Red Wine that we love to drink from good house of Napa Darioush [it pained me to taste a killed Darioush  Cabernet Sauvignon - My good old body who works there probably would cry] is overcooked turned to vinegar already at least 25 degree celcius also was served in white wine glass. Not in room temperature at least. There was a soup I don't what it is not definitely not lobster. They didn't even ask if I would want to eat pork. Serve us some kind of pre prepared won ton looking appetizer which we resend. Waiters described like he doesn't eat lamb and he doesn't know how and which temperature chef prepares. Steak was cold we had to rearm it. Then you can imagine what kind of shoe sole you eat. I have to be honest with you though wherever they got the chocolate cake was fresh.  Other than that enjoy the spider full of city view...Ohh I forgot to mention you have to pay $50  upfront for the table by the window reservation.

Went here for the fourth of July which was pretty cool because it was great viewing for the fireworks...especially since it was storming outside. The servers were very nice and the food was good (could have been a little better for the price). Seemed like food you would expect at a high end place...during the 90s and previous years. But culinary expectations have come a long way and I think the menu needs a little refresh or at least a refresh on plating. The taste was good though. Nothing to complain about there. The only other thing was the layout was a big circle and we were up against the interior wall and it seemed like a server trolley was passing by us every 10 seconds. Sounds like I complained a lot but it wasnt anything that was a deal breaker!

Like others said, you pay (hefty) for location and view. We went on a beautiful summer Saturday night when there were fireworks and there were empty tables. The view is terrific and the fireworks were a nice touch. We ordered a few appetizers then 3 of us shared the largest steak and sides. We thought the food and service was very good but yes, its about twice the price of many other decent restaurants.

Food was very bland. My husband and i noth had different meals and the food was not worth the price. Also, couldne see outside really, i dont know if it was due to the weather or the windows. I went to another establishment about an hour later and could see perfectly out the windows.
Most beautiful view of city and Lake Michigan.

The place is nice and has a beautiful view of the Chicago City. But I asked them to bring candles with the desert since it was my wife's birthday, and they forgot about it. I had to ask multiple people before it happened.
stupid Manager! bad experience!
Very irresponsible manager!

Awesome place

The view is amazing, but that's it. The food isn't very good (I'm pretty sure some of it was frozen, and micro greens on everything for some strange reason), and definitely over priced for what it was. The decor, music, and everything else is straight out of 1980s idea of fine dining (and not updated since then). Generally, the view is the only reason they're still in business.
Wonderful view but the food is not worth the price.

Yikes! I have no idea how this place has so many good reviews. Yes, the view is incredible, but that doesn’t make up for bland and ill-prepared food, awful service (not attentive at all), dirty tablecloths, scuffed chairs, ripped and stained menus, mismatched silverware, cheesy music... I could go on, but these people should be embarrassed of the food they are serving and the hideous decor. Maybe it’s okay for a drink and to take in the view, but DEFINITELY skip the meal. For $100+/person, you can have a much better dinner elsewhere in Chicago.
Neat and clean, very careful about hygiene. The waitress was beautiful and served us professionally.
Nice place to chill with friends. Exceptional view and a wide range of cuisine to choose from.
I had a good time last week in the restaurant. Food was tasty and service was fast.
Fast and superb customer service and dessert items are awesome.
The view is amazing. I just love it!
1 star for food. 1 star for an instant coffee 👎 You wouldn't expect being served an instant coffee in such a upscale restaurant!!!

The view is incredible! you're eating dinner 80 story's in the sky. you can see over downtown Chicago, and you're sitting right above the Lake Michigan. It's a beautiful site. Be advised that they automatically take out gratuity from your bill.
Great food and view.
Very bad place to go. You will be upset. Poor service. Very racist. I wouldn’t recommend this place to anyone.
Interesting place but the beer menu is terrible and the waiter ignored us for most of the night.

(Translated by Google) Never experienced anything so awful. If you are considering this restuarent, do not. The view is good, but you are not going to enjoy it. No air conditioning - why you get to sit in 40 degree heat, because it's like a greenhouse. So the choice was between letting the food get cold or eating the accompaniment alone afterwards. They forgot a dish, and we were then accused of it was because it was a cumbersome order. When we had to pay we went up to the counter but were ordered down in place but still ended up having to pay at the counter. (Original) Aldrig oplevet noget så forfærdeligt. Overvejer I denne restuarent, så lad være. Udsigten er god, men du kommer ikke til at nyde den. We went on May 5, 2018.  To start off it was 80 degrees out and the air conditioning wasn't working and they didn't pull the sun shades til after we were seated.  No air was flowing.   We were there for my birthday and I knew it was expensive but the menu had changed and increased from what is posted on line.   First of all my napkin had stains on it, there were bugs outside the window (not their fault) but it made me itchy and thinking they were inside.  OK   My Cosmo came without a lime twist and wasn't very good They never asked or told me what kind of vodka they used.  OK  We ordered a $22 appetizer platter for the table of 4 with prawns and oysters.  Naked oysters and good sized prawns.   There were 2 prawns and 2 oysters   VERY expensive.  OK  the mixed salad wasn't special and the dressing had too much dijon mustard in it.  OK   One person ordered a pork chop  It was thick and came with some apple dressing  $37.00 but it was good no sides.  One ordered Scallops $40.00 for THREE scallops with rissoto.  One person ordered Barramundi  fish small fish we doubt it was really Barramundi no sides $39 and the pieces de resistance is I ordered Lobster tail for $70.  It was dry and chewy.  It came with some dry layered potatoes I couldn't eat.   The chef came and said he could make a new one fast.   15 minutes later when everyone was done eating it appeared.   Same as first one.   Birthday ruined.  Great view and ambiance.   Don't go
Love going here for dessert and a drink. You do not need reservations to sit at the bar. The view is great and the desserts are great. The dress code is a mix of casual and fancy.
A Chicago must!
Very bad experience. It was very cold inside, although we asked twice to turn the heat up. Service was VERY slow. Portions were small. Bad food quality on top. Definitely it was overpriced!
Delicious food! Amazing atmosphere! Splendid view

The view was amazing. Our server was also very attentive and knowledgeable and genuinely personable and warm. I enjoyed the experience of dining here, however the food was not impressive or memorable.

The view is of course breath taking, our server was fantastic! And the food and drinks we had tasted amazing! The chef even came out to see how we liked our meal. If you can splurge a bit for a special occasion, this would be the place.
Amazing view! Amazing food! Spectacular service!!!

Amazing view, the food was amazing and huge portions. The steak was big enough for both of us and even tho I don't like well done steak (my dates choice) it was still one of the most amazing steaks I've ever had. Although I wasn't a fan of the mac n cheese or the wine, but that could of just been the one i had since I accepted what was suggested.

This place was horrible! The service was atrocious and the food was cold. No one checked with us after our food was dropped off and I wouldn’t recommend this to anyone. My boyfriend was going to propose at this scenic restaurant and had it arranged through our concierge. The manager acknowledged they’ve had problems and compensated on the bill for two sides. Go anywhere else.
Great views, the lobster Mac and cheese was to die for. Friendly service. I also went for restaurant week and had a good time.

AMAZING top floor view from the navy pier. However, food was mediocre at best and service was extremely lacking. We went for a special occasion, hoping for good service at a "fancy" restaurant, but we were left without anyone checking in on us between courses (on occasion, we didn't see our waiter for 20-30 minutes at a time) and even when we were done, we didn't receive our check for a long while where I had to get a bus boy to get my waiter. Worth going once, but unless there's a change, I wouldn't go again.
The food was amazing and that mushroom risotto made me want more and more. The view from the restaurant is beautiful. A great experience overall.

This place reminds me of top of the town in Cleveland Ohio back in the early 90s... Awesome food with a spectacular view...

I came to chicago from miami to visit and i research a lot of restaurants to go with my husband and my child tk have a good time and meet new things. The view was amazing and the service was medium. What i didn't like is that i asked for a mojito drink and it tasted horrible it was pure lemon juice. I asked the server to please bring another one and it was the same thing could't drink it. At the end i was expecting such a great night with my family and i ended up doing this review since i dont like doing reviews good or bad ablut any place. But well. I am just dissappointed.

Nice view, wine is a little over priced

Staff was very helpful and accommodating..especially the hostess Jocelyne Flores, she went above and beyond for us and I would come back just to receive her amazing customer service. We are looking forward to hosting here again.
Nice views and average food. Kind of overpriced.

I came here with my boyfriend on our anniversary. We both dressed fancy and the inside decor matched perfectly. The seating view we had was spectacular!!! You could see all of Chicago & the lake. It was night time so the city lit up so beautifully. The food was outstanding. Our bill was about $350 but well worth it. Had some great wine and one of the best surf and turf filet mignon and Maine lobster experiences ever. The gnocci was homemade and soo tender, was great. The lobster bisque had lobster chunks and such great seafood flavor. The duck trio with fois gras. ... what can I say? Perfect!  The crem brule was on point! I hope babe brings me here this year!!!

This place was nothing like what i expected. I really don't ever write reviews. Im not much of a complainer. Never the less me and my wife ordered similar food. My steak over cooked her steak very fatty. The thing that bummed me out the most no one ever came back to check up as to how the steak was. No one asked if we wanted another drink. I would most definitely give are tip to the bus boy. Very responsive about bringing are water. This place had terrible wait staff on. I would not waste your money 2 meals 2 drinks $190.00 plus tip. Food was no good. I would strongly recommend not wasting any money hear at all. Maybe a drink that's it. Much better places in Chicago to eat. My wife is a server and feels for other server. Even she was able to admit on called for.

To sum this experience up in one word is was horrible. Our entrees were cold and had no taste when we spoke to the general manger his response was he will speak to the chef and he will prepare us some warm food but it never came. Also said that he would take care of our meals but that was after we’ve paid for it. All I can say positive about this experience was the view amazing, that’s it!
(Translated by Google) Spectacular views, good service and good food.  (Original) Espectaculares vistas, buena atencion y buena comida.
Fantastic view, great food and amazing service. This is one of my favorite spots.

The service SalVadore provided was horrible. He was very unprofessional.  I was so offended. I will never patronize this establishment again. I will also spread the word to everyone I know about my experience. On the brighter side, the view was breath taking!

As many have said before me the only thing great about this experience is the view. The food is awfully overpriced and frankly just doesn’t come up to scratch. I would’ve had and have had btw a better experience at red lobster. We were served mashed potatoes and one of the dinner guests asked if they were real. The server replied they were but when I tasted them it was clear they were not! How do you pay $75 for crab legs (which should’ve been served with butter) and are then served box potatoes! The steak was tough and had no seasoning, thank God they had steak sauce. Then the bathroom, the bathroom smelled horrible. I literally stood for a moment wondering which stall to take. I was just that hesitant to go but my bladder wouldn’t allow for the wait lol smh... Just a huge let down overall and I will never, ever, step foot in this place again!

Hm, not quite sure what to say. It feels like a place from the early 80's. Definitely past it's glory. Service is weird. Waiter was endearing but didn't get half of it right. Views are great. Done, not going back.

This is a wonderful restaurant with a great view of Chicago from the 70th floor. The menu is full of delicious choices, or you can choose the chef's tasting menu for a wonderful selection if the best offerings. From the hostess to the waiter to the servers, all are friendly and wonderful at their jobs. Go for a special meal, and ask for Amir.
Place should be remodeled, bathrooms terrible. Food way too expensive for that quality. Service poor, waiting forever for my food. Only view is amazing

This place ... well, I expected a lot more.  Pros: the views were great, and the service itself was also very good. Staff was attentive and kept the dishes coming at a good pace. Our waiter, Amir, was also excellent.  Cons: the food really wasn’t anything special. I tried the ahi tuna and it was god awful. I actually gagged twice trying to swallow it. While the food was presented beautifully it didn’t really taste like it should, given the prices for everything. I wouldn’t go back.

We decided to come there for the first time for my husband's birthday because it looked good on the website , i reserved at 7:30 and told them it is for birthday. As we entered , the host was friendly but our server (amir) wasnt good. First, he didnt introduce himself and he just gave the wine menu to my husband without explaining the wine or the food menu. Then we ordered the 32 oz rib eye medium. The rib eye was exteremely chewy and it was 32 oz with the huge bone. We each had 3 pieces of meat which was chewy with no flavor. The server( amir) didnt even bother to come once to ask how was our food. After the food was done, we sat 10 min till someone else came and picked up our plates. He was chatting with the host and when he saw i looked at him , he brought the dessert menu without saying one word about the dessert or if we were happy with the food.  At last he charged us 20% tips without even telling us which in their menu it said we charge 20% for party of 6, but we were just two people. After he charged us, my husband asked why you charged 20% and he just said i can take it off if you want. He didnt even say thank you for coming. The one star i gave just represent the view which i could have had it with 30bucks instead of 200 bucks. Not recommanded.
Very fancy....like Jennifer!
great for a special occasions, wonderful if you can get a good view of the lake for the fireworks at night or even a view of the city.

As a seemingly upscale restaurant, this place is highly unorganized. Its common to have waiting issues, the manager is very aggressive and the food barely comes as decent. But for the price, I'd take my chances at Apple Bee's.
